intro: Rosa tomentosa var. vogesiaca, commonly known as the Voges rose, is a compact, shrub-like species native to Central Europe. It features dense, gray-green foliage covered in fine, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is well-suited for rock gardens or as a border plant due to its hardy nature and ornamental value. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for both gardeners and botanists interested in its horticultural and ecological properties.
